intro: Catabrosa stricta, commonly known as the rigid catabrosa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in the spring. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
